title: At Globe Summit, Elin Hilderbrand reflects on Nantucket, Hollywood, and writing with her daughter
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Local News The bestselling "Queen of Beach Reads" joined Love Letters’ Meredith Goldstein to discuss island life, screen adaptations, and her latest novel, “The Academy.
” (From left) Globe Love Letters columnist Meredith Goldstein hosted a “Fireside Chat” with Nantucket author Elin Hilderbrand at the Globe Summit on Nov.

title: Falmouth votes yes to turning historic golf course into solar farm
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News A representative town meeting gave the two-thirds vote needed to construct a 57-acre solar array atop a historic golf course.
A view of "The Volcano" at the Cape Cod Country Club in Falmouth.
Courtesy of Cape Cod Country Club A historic Cape Cod golf course passed a significant hurdle Monday night, gaining approval to work with the town to transform its fairways into solar panels.

title: ESPN ranks Mike Vrabel as second-best NFL head coaching hire of the year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Chicago's Ben Johnson got the top spot over Vrabel.
Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye.

Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe Mike Vrabel inherited a Patriots team that had gone 4-13 in each of the two previous seasons and immediately turned them into a playoff caliber team, but he’s still not the best among this year’s NFL head coaching hires, according to ESPN’s latest rankings.

title: Man accused of murder had previous case dropped due to public defender work stoppage
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Crime A Mattapan man was charged with possession of a dangerous weapon earlier this year.
It was dropped, and now he stands accused of a recent fatal stabbing.

MARK STOCKWELL FOR THE BOSTON GLOBE A Mattapan man who was arrested Sunday and charged with murder was also charged earlier this year with possession of a dangerous weapon, but had his case dropped due to the ongoing public defender work stoppage in Massachusetts.

title: 3 detained in Allston Car Wash immigration raid to be released on bond, lawyer says
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News An attorney for the three car wash workers said they were still waiting to be released from ICE custody Tuesday.
Allston Car Wash, where nine people were recently detained by ICE agents.

Lane Turner/Boston Globe Staff By Abby Patkin November 18, 2025 | 4:02 PM 2 minutes to read Even after posting bond, three of the nine workers detained in last week’s Allston Car Wash immigration raid were still waiting to be released from ICE custody Tuesday, according to their lawyer.

title: Quincy restaurant 16C to close after nearly a decade
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Food News Owner Kerri Lynch-Delaney said the Quincy Center restaurant will close in December.
The margherita pizza at the 16C restaurant in Quincy.
Debee Tlumacki for the Boston Globe 16C, a beloved American restaurant in Quincy Center known for its sheet pan pizza and the original ‘Quiet Man’ steak tips, will close at the end of December.

title: Bentley professor missing on Maine island
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News Wiley Davi has been missing since Saturday.
Wiley Davi.
Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife A search is ongoing for a missing Bentley University professor in Maine.

title: Jordan Walsh has found his role with the Celtics
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics “I thought he was very good, and I thought he made some winning plays throughout the entire game.
” Jordan Walsh in a press conference on media day (Michael Dwyer/AP Photo).
Following Jayson Tatum’s Achilles injury and a number of offseason moves, the Celtics look different this season compared to the last few years.

title: Registered sex offender facing charges after stolen firearm, Nazi materials allegedly found in his possession
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The 30-year-old Dracut man is also being investigated for allegedly paying for child sexual abuse materials.
A registered sex offender from Dracut has been charged for allegedly illegally possessing a firearm and ammunition, which were found amongst Nazi materials, federal authorities said.
In 2016, Tyler Bullock, 30, was convicted of purchasing or possessing child pornography, according to the Massachusetts U.

title: Bruins’ Johnny Beecher claimed off waivers by the Flames
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins “I didn't really care about his past, but it was up to him.
So that's how I see it.
" Johnny Beecher played in over 130 games with the Bruins.
